p:
The peaks around 1700 cm −1 are distinctive in hexane, and the dichloromethane fractions spectra are associated with carbonyl groups (C=O). These signals can be related to the major compounds in these fractions such as prenylated benzophenones
55 and phenolic compounds
56 . The peaks at 1600 cm −1 are usually correlated to the stretching vibration of carboxylate anion –COO −, probably due to the oxidation of polyphenols during Au +3 reduction
10, 57 . These bands show large amounts of alcohol or phenol in plant extracts.
